intro: Sopubia dregeana var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sopubia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found growing in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
